The Great Australian Waste Problem

Look at the number of landfills Australia has. Every coloured cirle is a working landfill. If waste generation keeps increasing, Australia will soon become a huge landfill.

By 2018, Australia generated an estimated 67 millions tons of waste but only 37 million were recycled.

Australia isn't recycling, its just collecting.

To know more about Australian waste, click on the individual waste type links given below

Food Waste Plastic Waste
Source: What a waste 2.0, http://datatopics.worldbank.org/what-a-waste/
